intro: Iris ruthenica subsp. brevituba, commonly known as the narrow tube iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features striking blue to violet flowers with a distinctive, narrow, tubular structure at the base of the petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has grass-like, sword-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in alpine meadows. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental beauty and is cultivated in gardens for its unique floral form.
